definitions: To stay in a place longer than necessary because of a reluctance to leave.
To continue to exist or be felt for a long time, often after the main part has gone.
To spend a long time over something, often in a slow or hesitant way.
examples: She liked to linger over her morning coffee.
The scent of her perfume lingered in the room.
He lingered at the doorway, unwilling to depart.
